title: CNN
text: The CNN succeeded because not every neuron in a layer is connected to all neurons in a different layer. Besides the hnadling was changed into a scale invariant method.The cnn network trains the values for the kernels. The input layer becomes the amount of pixels.

title: CNN
text:
General information






NotePerceptive field



The receptive field is the combination of pixels that, the specific neuron is using as input





Screenshot of slide


Repeating this turns into:



Screenshot of slide








TipKernel



These k*k weights basically provide a kernel and therefore we are training the kernels. The weights w become the parameters of the filters


Each picture contains 3 colors so for every color there are three channels. Due to this the kernels are not 2x2 but most of the times it is 3x3.
You can apply different kernels in the same layer which also creates extra depth. This is happening in a different channel. This channel is also called a This depth is why we call it deep learning.



Screenshot of Slide


A pooling layer takes the outcomes of the convulotion layer and applies a kernel over this. In most cases this is a max-pool which selects the highest value. The following image shows an example for this.



Screenshot of lecture slide of pooling layer


The stride is how many pixels it moves to the left. Stride 2 is therefore jumping over 1 pixel.
The low level features are learned in the ealrier layers. The higher level features are learned in later layers.
A fully connected layer is applied to all of the result to get the final prediction.

title: CNN
text:
Applying techniques

1d convulotion
1d convulotion is applied to the last convulotion layer such that the depth is reduced to 1 again.



Screenshot of 1d convulotion




How to reduce overfitting?

Simplify the model (reduce the amount of neurons and layers)
Penalize high values for kernels by regularization
Dropout, randomly remove some of the neurons in the network during each iteration
